clues.text: The nests built by the cave swiftlet of Southeast Asia are used in making this oriental soup
This chewy Italian-style sausage takes its name from the Italian word for chili pepper
Kind of shellfish you'd be eating if a French waiter served you "homard Thermidor"
A German type of these is made with 3 kinds of ground meat & called "Königsberger Klopse"
Cauliflower, broccoli, kale & Brussels sprouts belong to this vegetable family
This 93-year-old actor-comedian drinks tea from a cup that says "God"
The 5-block-long Gotham City set for this film is the largest built for a movie since "Cleopatra"
Luis Valdez who wrote & directed "Zoot Suit", also wrote & directed this 1987 film about Ritchie Valens
"Charlie's Angels" producer who has sparked controversy by building an enormous home in Holmby Hills
In 1988 he won the "Best Supporting Actor" Oscar for his role in "The Untouchables"
After the fall of Napoleon, the Congress of Vienna guaranteed neutrality to this country
In 1692 this royal couple removed William Penn as governor of Pennsylvania
This small country launched the age of exploration in the 13th century
Russian women were granted the vote in this history-making year for the USSR
Founded in Vienna in 1923, its Paris headquarters is staffed mainly by French police officers
If a Roman split something L-L, this was how it was divided
Number of the house where Susan, Gordon & Olivia live on "Sesame Street"; remembering it is as easy as ABC
Pat Robertson began his religious TV program when this many people pledged $10 a month
The, electoral college has 538 members & you need at least this many of them to vote for you to win
In 1960 Kennedy & Nixon debated one another this many times
Peter Prichard's 1987 book "The Making of McPaper" told the inside story of this national newspaper
This first lady's book "To Love a Child" featured stories about the foster grandparent program
In 1984 Thomas Peters & Robert H. Waterman Jr. made the best seller list "In Search of" this
"The Bastard", "The Rebels" & "The Seekers" are 3 books in this author's Kent Family Chronicles
"The House of the Dead" was this Russian author's fictionalized account of his prison years
This city of some 70,000 is Delaware's largest
In 1907 these seasonal stamps were sold for the 1st time in the U.S. in Delaware
The date displayed on Delaware's state flag indicates this
clues.response: the date that Delaware became part of the United States, or the First State

clues.text: The 1st permanent settlement was Fort Christina founded in 1638 by people from this country
This former governor was one of the early contenders in the last presidential race
Archie Costello leads the Vigils, a gang of school kids enforcing the sale of this title sweet treat in a Robert Cormier "War" novel
Luke, the son of Hermes, betrays this title kid at Camp Half-Blood by poisoning him; not cool
In this S.E. Hinton novel, it's the Socs vs. the Greasers, & Dally is a bit of a thug
With a name fit for a Roman emperor, this rude boy falls into Willy Wonka's river & gets sucked up by a super pipe
"You've been brought up bad... Fagin will make something of you", says this rascal to Oliver Twist
To become involved with something lucrative before a larger group of people learns about it is to "get in" here
It's what you should avoid doing proverbially if you live in a glass house
In other words, "when one won't tolerate temperature, remove oneself from food-making facilities"
clues.response: if you can't take the heat, get out of the kitchen

clues.text: Curiosity, a good memory & some wagering skill are this colorful plan "for success" on "Jeopardy!"
To reinforce a viewpoint, idiomatically as in "you need to" this structural support "your argument with hard facts"
My friend, I can put you in a Ghost from this British car maker today... if you happen to have $400,000
Folks were not happy he went electric at 1965's Newport Folk Festival but in 2013 the Fender Strat he used went for $965,000
In 1989 Jerry Jones bought this NFL team for $140 million; a decent investment, as it's worth more than $7 billion today
Symbolically hot off the press, this book--one of roughly 50 left in the world--was auctioned in 1987 for $5.39 million
In 2014 a golden oval item a man hoped to sell as scrap metal was actually this Russian treasure & worth $33 million
Dam, it's a vacuum, too!
Baseball's Mookie & Hack (who had 191 RBIs in 1930--you should know his last name!)
A place where a river is shallow enough to be crossed by wading
An animated "Show" formerly on Fox, or an Ohio city
Synonyms for this include prick, perforate & puncture
On live TV, Dutch PM Mark Rutte said don't perform this greeting ritual due to COVID, but forgot & put 'er there moments later

In 1938 this prime minister abandoned British naval bases in Ireland & stood by as Italy took over Ethiopia... oops
In 1973 Luis Carrero Blanco became PM, taking power in Spain from this man, but was assassinated 6 months later
In 2014 this nation said no to PM Fredrik Reinfeldt & Stefan Lofven, running for the Riksdag for the 1st time, got the job

rounds.comments: (Ken: The Museum of Modern Art in New York City.)

clues.text: Jeff Koons' version of this colorful feline made famous by Peter Sellers on film is on floor 2
Her 1977 oil on canvas "From a Day with Juan II" was a bequest of this painter from New Mexico

Mais oui, you can take a trip back in time to 1899 & survey his "Tahitian landscape"
His "Number 1A, 1948", which includes some of his handprints, has been on exhibit in the David Geffen Galleries
